body.p: There are two main branches (or forks) of the Comedi drivers:

ul.li: the original Comedi drivers maintained at comedi.org; and
the newer Comedi drivers maintained as part of the Linux kernel.

body.p: There are some differences in the supported devices and the names of the kernel modules in which they are supported, so they are listed below in separate sub-sections for the original comedi.org drivers and the newer drivers in the Linux kernel.
body.h2: Hardware supported by the comedi.org Comedi drivers
body.p: This is the list of hardware supported by the original Comedi drivers maintained at comedi.org.

N.B. The list is extracted from specially formatted comments in the driver sources. For that reason, some supported devices are unlisted. (Notably, all the ADDI-DATA devices are unlisted, but they do not follow the usual Comedi driver conventions very well.)
body.h2: Hardware supported by the Linux kernel Comedi drivers
body.p: This is the list of hardware supported by the branch of the Comedi drivers maintained within the Linux kernel sources.

N.B. The list is extracted from specially formatted comments in the driver sources. For that reason, some supported devices are unlisted. (Notably, several supported ADDI-DATA devices are unlisted. This will be remedied once the specially formatted comments are added to the relevant driver sources.)
